p: Igbo-Ora and Babanki viruses belong to the Alphavirus genus and Togaviridae family and cause diseases in humans. Both of them are arthropod-borne viruses. Igbo-Ora virus was first isolated in Nigeria ( 1). Initially considered a separate alphavirus species, Igbo-Ora virus was later confirmed to be a strain of Oâ€™nyong-nyong virus ( 2). Babanki virus was first isolated in Northwest Cameroon in 1969 and is a strain of Sindbis virus ( 3).
